channel.title: Julien Demare - E-Commerce and Payments Specialist
channel.description: Julien Demare - E-Commerce and Payments Specialist

item.title: Startups need to respect the laws of retail physics
item.description:
Startups need to respect the laws of retail physics

Startups like Warby Parker, Bonobos and Casper have proven that it's possible to build a modern brand predominately using digital tools. As a result, a flood of early-stage tech VCs have barged into the market like Walmart shoppers on Black Friday. Andy Dunn of Bonobos recently christened this class of company as Digitally Native Vertical Brands, or "DNVBs."

item.title: In a year, Amazon and Alibaba will dominate Indian ecommerce: Vijay Shekhar Sharma - The Economic Times
item.description:
In a year, Amazon and Alibaba will dominate Indian ecommerce: Vijay Shekhar Sharma - The Economic Times

NEW DELHI:The fight for India's lucrative ecommerce market will be mainly between Amazon and Alibaba, with the contours of the battle likely to be clearer in about a year, says Vijay Shekhar Sharma, chief executive officer of Paytm, a company backed by the Chinese online retailing giant.

item.title: Bidroom secures €1 million funding, goes global this year #NLTech
item.description:
Bidroom secures €1 million funding, goes global this year #NLTech

A Booking-com-killer might seem a bit over-ambitious. But while they are not quite there yet, travel-startup Bidroom is still going strong, and growing fast. Today the company, based in The Hague, announces it raised €1 million from informal investors.

item.title: A PayPal Takeover by MasterCard Would 'Destroy Value,' Bernstein Says
item.description:
A PayPal Takeover by MasterCard Would 'Destroy Value,' Bernstein Says

It's extremely unlikely that MasterCard Inc. would buy out PayPal Holdings Inc., Bernstein analyst Lisa Ellis wrote in an e-mail Tuesday amid speculation that a deal may be on the table. Bringing the competitors together wouldn't make strategic sense since the two business models are so different, she said.

item.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook Joins Nike as Lead Independent Director
item.description:
Apple CEO Tim Cook Joins Nike as Lead Independent Director

Today has proven to be quite the busy day for Nike. In addition to the official departure of Founder, Phil Knight, who will be replaced by Mark Parker who will continue to serve in the role of President and CEO - in addition to his new duties as Chairman - the Swoosh has also made public that Apple CEO, Tim Cook, will become Nike's Lead Independent Director after serving as chair of the board's compensation committee up until this point.

item.title: Brexit could be a huge setback for European startups
item.description:
Brexit could be a huge setback for European startups

To understand why the recent Brexit vote is a gigantic step in the wrong direction for European startups, take a close look at Outfittery, a Berlin-based ecommerce company. The Outfittery, founded in 2012 by Anna Alex and Julia Bösch to deliver a personalized fashion shopping experience, has raised more than $38 million in venture capital and has enjoyed steady growth.

item.title: The Recursive Product Strategy That Musk Used To Build An Empire
item.description:
The Recursive Product Strategy That Musk Used To Build An Empire

This article is by Vinny Lingham , co-founder and CEO of personal identity protection startup Civic Build sports car Use that money to build an affordable car Use that money to build an even more affordable car While doing above, also provide zero emission electric power generation options Don't tell anyone.

item.title: Rocket Internet merges ecommerce sites Daraz and Kaymu across Asia - The Express Tribune
item.description:
Rocket Internet merges ecommerce sites Daraz and Kaymu across Asia - The Express Tribune

German startup juggernaut Rocket Internet announced today the merger of its ecommerce marketplaces Daraz and Kaymu under a new entity Daraz Group. Both Daraz and Kaymu operate in frontier markets in Asia. Daraz, which is a managed marketplace fashioned on the likes of Lazada, is currently operational in Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar.

item.title: Christopher Kane's Next Milestone: E-Commerce
item.description:
Christopher Kane's Next Milestone: E-Commerce

LONDON, United Kingdom - "I never want to be that person who's taking advantage or seen to be derivative... I think that's the whole point of being creative," says designer Christopher Kane. "It's not about being lazy anymore, especially in this day and age. People just want newness - they strive for it.
